sentence.Network_en: He was their adviser, confidant and father confessor.

Major Pendennis became the Begum's confidant and house friend.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: alteration of confident (as a noun in the same sense in the early 17th cent.), probably to represent the pronunciation of French confidente 'having full trust'

entry.def: Someone's confidant is a man who they are able to discuss their private problems with.

means.word_mean: 1. someone to whom private matters are confided

auth_sentence.content: He...was the safest confidant to be found within the four seas.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He...was the safest confidant to be found within the four seas.

auth_sentence.content: He was also described as a confidant of Zetas boss Heriberto Lazcano Lazcano.

auth_sentence.content: Their son James says, I don't know of any confidant other than my mother.

stems_affixes.word_buile: confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ent……的→adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的

stems_affixes.word_buile: confident[adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的]+ial……的→相信的人才知道
dif不+fid相信+ent……的→不相信[自己]→自卑的
fid信任,相信,信念+uciary……的→相信的→信托的
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
af一再+fid信任,相信,信念+avit表名词→一再发誓相信→宣誓书
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ant人→confidant可以吐露真情的人
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ence表名词→n.[in]信任;信心,自信;秘密,机密
fid信任,相信,信念+elity表示性质→相信的性质
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
per假+fid相信+y状态→假相信→不忠诚
